Detailed Description

Class defining the main application window.

The main window class is used when there are docked windows, toolbars, and status bars

Note
To avoid a border around internal widgets, a basic QWidget will need to be used

Member Function Documentation

◆ className()

virtual const char* rev::MainWindow::className ( ) const
inlinevirtual

The name of this class.

Every subclass should redefine/override this property to return its name

◆ contextMenuEvent()

void rev::MainWindow::contextMenuEvent ( QContextMenuEvent *  event)

Generates a context menu, overriding default implementation.

Note
Context menus can be executed either asynchronously using the popup() function or synchronously using the exec() function

◆ namespaceName()

virtual const char* rev::MainWindow::namespaceName ( ) const
inlinevirtual

The full namespace for this class.

Every subclass should redefine/override this property to return its full namespace. The built in logging methods will use this value for the message category
